posts.post_content:
Total shot in the dark: do you have a Victory Wilhelm ?


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Mark, let me know if you have a price on the Lennox. I don't want to make a lowball offer. Rob

That card is spectacular and the Victory's are one of the "Holy Grails" for Louisiana collectors.

Rick
it is a nice card and i'm glad i've had the opportunity to own it. it's card #4 in my collection of 5 (ewing w/mascot #5), i've decided to move away from the hobby :(

[quote name="lug-nut" post=1869558]it is a nice card and i'm glad i've had the opportunity to own it. it's card #4 in my collection of 5 (ewing w/mascot #5), i've decided to move away from the hobby :([/QUOTE]

Hi Mark, the hobby will be here when/if you decide to return!
I know and I hope to some day but I'm really looking forward to finding something along this line.. '67-68 maybe in a nice blue

[quote name="lug-nut" post=1870968]I know and I hope to some day but I'm really looking forward to finding something along this line.. '67-68 maybe in a nice blue[/QUOTE]


If your gonna leave the hobby, atleast buy a Chevelle or Nova!:p

[quote name="lug-nut" post=1870968]I know and I hope to some day but I'm really looking forward to finding something along this line.. '67-68 maybe in a nice blue[/QUOTE]

gotta be the fastback!!!

I bought this a few months ago. I smile every time I get in it. 

I drove a '68 Mustang a long time ago. It had a 289 3 or 4 speed. Cool car. But this current one rocks too. 6 speed manual with 306 HP.....fun fun...

[quote name="Leon" post=1871348]I bought this a few months ago. I smile every time I get in it....[/QUOTE]

This confirms my long-held suspicion that the Net54 dues we pay are too high!  :D

[quote name="Knoxy24" post=1871103]If your gonna leave the hobby, atleast buy a Chevelle or Nova!:p[/QUOTE]

Had a '73 Nova, not a fan...originally started with the '68 camaro but I do wanna return to vintage cards so I'm going with my 2nd choice of the mustang

Looks like fun Leon

by the way, the card sold :)
My wife recently was gifted this 1958 Impala from her Uncle. She has discussed with me how long I can continue to collect both cards and pay the bills for that. I can only tell her I don't know!
"gifted this 1958 impala" sounds like it should 1. be paid off and 2. only need gas :)   nice car.

[quote name="lug-nut" post=1871656]"gifted this 1958 impala" sounds like it should 1. be paid off and 2. only need gas :)   nice car.[/QUOTE]It was paid off, but then we took a loan against it with the in-laws to have another child. So whenever we sell it they have partial claim to the money. So we make payments to them every so often to reduce their share in the car. 

It also sat outside in Vegas for 10-15 years not running. It does run, but there are some issues with it, like no working speedometer, and only half the windows rolling down. Some other odd and end things here and there. Upholstery is fragile and will probably need to be replaced eventualy. 

But it is a sweet ride. Uncle cut the springs, and so everywhere we go is low and slow.  :)

Sent from my SAMSUNG-SM-G930A using Tapatalk
I stand corrected. Low and slow is always nice.
